result.execSummary:
The defendant James T Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:15 PM Cases called: 22CF113 and 22CM395 Prosecuting attorney Matthew Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James T Brown in custody, in court.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for James T Brown. There is an agreement. 

Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count 1 in 22CM395: Obstructing an Officer and Count 1 in 22CF113: Possession of Methamphetamine. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant guilty. 

Court orders:

22CM395: 5 days jail or 40 hours of community service, court costs and DNA sample and surcharge. 5 days of jail credit. 
22CF113: court costs including 2 warrant fees, and DNA sample and surcharge.

Anything else is ordered dismissed and read in.
Plea hearing on June 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

10:09 AM Cases called: 22CF113 & 22CM395. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James T Brown not in court, in Eau Claire County Jail and not brought over.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for James T Brown. Parties are close to an agreement. 
Plea Hearing: 06/06/22 at 1:15pm
Arraignment on June 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

(Cases 22CF113, 22CM395 are called at 10:16 AM) Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James T Brown not in court.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for James T Brown. 
Defendant in custody but not brought over. Defense indicates a new offer he needs to review with the Defendant. State indicates this is the 5th attempt to hold an Arraignment. 
Arraignment in 22CF113 and Hearing in 22CM395: 06/06/2022 at 9:30 AM.
Arraignment on May 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

(11:09 AM cases 22CM395, 22CF113 called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant James T Brown appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by video for James T Brown.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint in 22CM395.
Court orders the warrant is quashed.
State requests the $500.00 cash bond ordered in 22CF113 be ordered to cover both cases. Attorney Anderson requests signature bond.
Court orders $250.00 cash bond with conditions to cover both cases.
Scheduling to be completed by Branch 3 Judicial Assistant and 22CM395 to ride along.

Conditions:
No contact with Park Tower Apartments.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level. 
(Covers 22CF113, 22CM395)

11:29 AM Defendant James T Brown not in court.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for James T Brown.  Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Thorson has no additional information for the Court. State requests a warrant. Warrant ordered. $500 cash bond ordered.
Arraignment on April 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Case called at 11:09 AM.
Defendant James T Brown appeared by video, in custody from the jail with Attorney Alicia Linzmeier. Attorney Monica Fallon appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Warrant quashed. State requests $500 Cash Bond (Lengthy history of failing to appear). Court orders the previous bond to continue.
ARGN: 4/19/22 at 11:30 AM  (Br 3).

1:47 PM case called. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant James T Brown not in court, Attorney Robert Allen Thorson for James T Brown appeared in court.  
Defense makes statement regarding their attempts to be in contact with the defendant. Court makes a statement and orders a warrant.
Arraignment on March 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:46 PM case called and held via Zoom. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Kirkpatrick appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant James T Brown not in court, Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared by video for James T Brown. Defense makes a record of their attempts to contact the defendant. Off the record to allow time for the defendant to join the Zoom hearing. 
3:00 PM Back on the record. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant James T Brown appeared by phone, Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared by video for James T Brown. Court adjourns matter. ARGN is re scheduled for 3/9/22 at 1:30 PM (in person).
Arraignment on March 4, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Same as Complaint.

(2:34 PM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Andrew Gunderson appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant James T Brown appeared in court. Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared in court for James T Brown.
State calls Officer Connor Beres of the Eau Claire Police Department, who is sworn and testifies.
Attorney Thorson conducts cross-examination of Officer Beres. Witness excused.
States moves for bind over. Attorney Thorson has no argument.
Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over.
Attorney Thorson to schedule an Arraignment with Branch 3 Judicial Assistant.
